title: Worth every one of those 10 stars
review: I found the Joker trailer pretty compelling but then when I came across the dozens and dozens of 1 star reviews here opposing all the dozens and dozens of 10 star reviews I sat there wondering how the hell could a film divide so many people so massively? There were so many that I couldn't ignore it, I started watching the movie thinking there was a possibility I would be bitterly disappointed.In the end I was delighted to discover it is indeed a masterpiece, a fantastic piece of cinematic history, one of the most enjoyable movies I have watched in a long time. The acting is just superb, the story excellent, the musical score was quite haunting and the directing was exquisite - quite simply 10 out of 10.How could so many people not enjoy it? The only explanation I can come up with it that perhaps they went to the cinema expecting a Batman movie, or hoping that it would be a CGI-packed action movie like the typical DC comic movie. If that's what you were expecting then I can understand the disappointment but to give it just 1 star because you felt stupid or foolish is really unfair.This is an incredibly compelling origin story with some sensational acting that deserves every Oscar it wins (which I am sure it will) but to those of you expecting a standard Batman or Ironman flick or if you're hoping for Wonder Woman to jump out from behind a car then you will be disappointed. It is a fantastic movie.

title: Film Review: Joker
review: Having watched this last night, I am in a trance. This film was absolutely brilliant, but it is not for the faint hearted. Joaquin Phoenix does the best Joker we've seen since The Dark Knight and he must receive Best Actor for this. This film is not so gory it should be an 18, but it is particularly gory. In one scene, a man is stabbed with scissors and his head is bashed against a wall. The aftermath is disgusting. Strong language occurs throughout the film. Beware, this is NOT a superhero movie. This film is about mental health and it is not in any way about the DC universe. Even my dad liked it, and that's saying something.3 out of 5 found this helpful.Was this review helpful?Sign into vote.Permalink

title: Phenomenal!
review: I loved every minuet of Joker. I was extremely happy when I found out that we would be solely looking into the Jokers character and identifying what makes him tick and what causes his characteristics. Now before i go into what I loved about the cinematography, i need to say Joaquin Phoenix played the character exceptionally. His laughter to his delivery to his weight loss, Joaquin really made the character convincing and mesmerized me. It's amazing how we feel sympathy for someone who killed people and see the antagonistic as the protagonist in a way. Furthermore, Joaquin got the Joker's laugh on point. Not only is the laugh pretty psychotic, but we wince at the pain he goes through when he start to cough uncontrollably.Moving onto the cinematography Lawrence Sher did a amazing job with his colour correction, his composition to his use of semiotic theory. The use of the grungy dark green and dimmed black really conveys the tone of the film. Especially in the bathroom scenes and the subway shots. However, the composition was the aspect that really blew me away. Lawrence really used his surroundings to not only get rid of negative space and make the film look beautiful, but he is fantastic a making the viewers eyes look at a certain part of the screen.I could go on and on about this film, however, being a young film student I don't feel like I am in a position where i can criticize this films cinematography or direction. However, if i would have to give one improvement it would be certain tweaks to parts of the script. Mainly when it comes to his family relationship. I would of loved to have seen more of that.A amazing film and a must watch!

title: Brilliant
review: I was hesitant to watch this film as the reviews I read weren't good. It was described as "artsy" and "slow". My guess now is that those reviews were written by toddlers. This film is nothing like the typical Batman movies however it still has great action scenes. In my opinion, this film is far better than the typical superhero/villain movies. How it subtly focuses on mental health issues is just wonderful. People like myself can relate in a deeper way than the average movie goer. As for the acting...wow, blown away. Joaquin has shown many times hes a great actor but his talent in this film is unmatched. It pushed him to the very top of my favorites list. If you love a good story, great characters, intense action and a film that makes you think, you will not be disappointed!3 out of 5 found this helpful.Was this review helpful?Sign into vote.Permalink

title: Joker - Movie Review
review: I knew that I loved Joker when I first saw it, but I have now seen it three times and it just keeps getting better with every rewatch. Obviously, the shining achievement of this film is Joaquin Phoenix as Arthur Fleck. There isn't really much I can say about his performance that hasn't already been said, but I would be completely shocked and a little upset if he doesn't win the Oscar for Best Actor.Phoenix perfectly embodied the role of a man who was beaten down and broken by the society that he was being forced to live in, and we as an audience were able to completely understand where he was coming from. That doesn't mean that we approve of his actions, but all of the best villains are the people with a backstory that we can understand, and this absolutely happened in Joker.The supporting actors all played their parts as well, and there wasn't a single weak link to the film. I am shocked that Todd Phillips went from directing films like The Hangover and Due Date, to Joker. I never knew he has this level of talent within him, but now I am genuinely excited to see where he will go from here. Having rewatched Joker a few times now, Philips scatters breadcrumbs throughout the film that I was able to pick up when revisiting it, and he also pays attention to loads of insignificant details which I loved.The score was also phenomenal, and added to the tone of the picture. I also really liked the cinematography, because every frame had care put into it and was able showcase exactly what Phillips was going for. I loved everything about Joker, and consider it to definitely be one of the best comic book movies ever made, even if it doesn't go about it in the traditional sense.Plain and simple, Joker is a masterpiece, and it just gets better the more I watch it.SCORE: 100%

title: Love hate relationship
review: Love this movie ... but I hate it. It's about mental illness. It's not a joker movie. It breaks my heart but it's so good! I won't ever watch it again tho it's so sad3 out of 5 found this helpful.Was this review helpful?Sign into vote.Permalink

title: Send in the clown...
review: Last night I finally got to watch this film. 'The Joker' is thrilling from beginning to end. This take on the very iconic character was just so intriguing. Arthur is such a fully realized character. His story is both a tragedy and a comedy. The movie follows this character from the misunderstood tragic clown to his descent into madness. And Joaquin Phoenix captures all of this really well with his Oscar-worthy performance. He's one hell of an actor. This movie works so well because of him.Yes, there are a lot of similarities and homages to several films like ' Taxi Driver' but I think Todd Phillips and everyone did such an amazing job making this movie so it stands on its own. The score by composer Hildur Guonadottir was terrific as well.I think a lot of people can relate to a character like Arthur. He's the forgotten man. The weirdo. Cast aside by society. No one gave a crap about him and it's a real shame. The system failed him and many others. Mental illness is such a big problem in society and I feel we all need to be better at understanding and being supportive. You never truly know what's going on in someone's mind. We as a society create monsters. A person can only take so much until they just snap. And Arthur definitely snapped. His message may not be entirely wrong and we can all agree with him on some points, but his actions certainly were wrong. Send in the clown...

title: Very dark, violent and beautiful...
review:
I don't think enough critics understand the concept and the style of this movie because they thought the movie was too dark and too violent, If you see the reviews for this movie, don't listen to them, watch it! Because "Joker" is one of the best comic book films I've seen in 2019 since "Endgame".
Joaquin Phoenix was excellent as the Joker, everytime you hear him laugh, you know you're in for a great time, Robert De Niro is also in this movie and that's exciting to hear about. The cinematography, the score, the acting, the atmosphere of Gotham, everything about this movie is amazing.
I did heard some people talk about of how the movie's similar to "Taxi Driver" and "The King of Comedy", and yes I could see that, and to me it makes me want to watch "Taxi Driver" for the first time, I never seen "The King of Comedy" though, but I might later.
Although, what people are most talking about is the level of violence in this movie, and yes I know it could very controversial to hear about and it could inspire a person to do it, and it happened before, but come on guys, It's JUST a movie, everything about the violence is set-up behind the production.
Overall, "Joker" is an amazing film with beautiful cinematography, amazing score and an amazing performance by Joaquin Phoenix, This is easily one of the best comic book films I've ever seen.Score: 10/10 ---- Highly Recommended

title: Top contender for 9th Feb, 2020
review:
So Joker is now at #26 in the list of top rated movies of all time in IMDb at the time of writing this. After watching the movie I critically examined the top 25 movies that are ahead of Joker right now, and concluded a few can actually go ahead of this - a very few. And movies like The Dark Knight, The Silence of the Lambs, Fight Club and a few others may not be eligible for sitting ahead of Joker.All in all, Joker now onwards should be synonym of Joaquin Phoenix. With due respect, the age is Heath Ledger is gone. Joaquin cries, laughs, bleeds, runs, sweats, sings, dances and kills. Gives everything to create a towering character in the history of cinema, and in the history of movie acting. In each frame you can feel the pain of the deprived and dispossessed man. In each frame you can witness how a simple and chaste man can be transformed into a villain by the torments of the society when all of his tries go in vain.And finally we must congratulate Todd Phillips for this masterpiece and thank him for creating an eternal character here.92nd Academy Awards:Best actor: Joaquin Phoenix
Best director: Todd Phillips
Best movie: Joker.

title: What doesn't love you simply makes you ...stranger!!!
review: Hello there ...Todd Phillip's Joker is here to hit you with a smile stronger than a thousand fists,A realistic depiction of an iconic Cartoon character , strongly influenced by masterpieces of the past , If you were amazed by movies such as Martin Scorsese's Taxi Driver and King of Comedy , then you are in for a treat , but does it stop there?Absolutely not, Phillips managed to combine landmark storylines from the myths cartoon artists gave us, such as Alan Moore's The Killing Joke with classic cinema masterpieces in modern society while he takes us in a deep dive of society's everyday problems and psychology, he dresses his movie with an outstanding soundtrack by talented young composer Hildur Gu√∞nad√≥ttir (she also gave us the score to drama miniseries Chernobyl ),and a colorful cinematography, creating something new and sadistically beautiful because you can't help yourself but to fall in love with the main character although you know he is the bad guy ... or is he not?It's already a classic, and I dare to say a landmark because I believe is going to be a great influence for future movies,of course Joaquin Phoenix's portrayal stands as one of the greats in cinema history , is Joker sane or crazy , is he a product of society or his twisted imagination, a criminal mastermind or a straw dog? maybe he is all of the above ... this movie will leave you with mixed feelings and a lots of thoughts ... it gets deep in you and makes you think what makes us human ... is it a smile always true , is it happiness ? and yet no matter how hurt you are there is always a rainbow after the storm ...

title: Rated R for realistic
review: I remember watching batman in the 90s, even the cartoon was darker and more emotionally compelling then the most modern superhero movie franchises. The back stories of the villains painted a picture into their behavior. Most were tormented in some way or had some twisted take on justice. In some ways they were initially right. Batman wouldn't just try to stop them, he'd try to help them.As for the movie itself, as others have said haunting and compelling. It takes the simple concept we've seen to have forgotten above and blasted us with reality. Their are sad and broken people all around us.If this was a true story he probably would have just ended up as a homeless beggar. Instead we get a fairy tale villain. So you don't have to keep feeling sorry for him. But the movie does a good enough job to keep that in the back of your mind whether you realize it or not.If they could achieve this level with Clay Face, Gator Guy etc that would be epic. Enjoy!

title: Joachin Phoenix is worth every penny
review: I've watched most of Joachin Phoenix films, most have been wierd and underwhelming, Even though underneath it all he's obviously a very talented actor. I've always felt he's just picked not so great films to act in with not so great story lines or dialogue. Joachin Phoenix shines throughout this movie and truly shows what a very talented actor he is. I actually cant imagine anyone else to have played Joker,too even remotely as well as Joachin Phoenix.This film is triumphant and although I did go in expecting it to be a decent film, as it had pretty good reviews. I was gripped right from the beginning to the end with some edge of the seat scenes and it was a lot better than I was expecting to be honest. The storyline his character were good also, but it would not have worked so well with anyone else playing Joker. The very sad part of this film,like being let down by society is actually true as I've seen it first hand. I'm not talking about the USA, but the United Kingdom and it's getting worse as were sadly turning into an I'm alright jack society. Where mostly people just think about themselves which makes this film even more real to me. Anyway I'm rambling ,I actually agree that this film is a masterpiece and I'm not a fan usually of DC films. I think this film will be Joachin Phoenix's greatest success story as I cant see him topping this purely raw but superb movie. It would be nice now to see another Batman movie vs the Joker maybe Christian Bale as Batman and of course Joachin as Joker. I think that would be another film worth watching. Go watch it and enjoy an acting performance of a lifetime.

title: The Broken Clown Prince
review: When I first saw the 'Joker' in "The Dark Knight" I fell in love with the character, because of his somewhat correct motives and the way he thinks. I had never seen a character like him before in any movie, which made it so new and refreshing to watch. When the "Joker" movie was announced I was stunned. Especially when I noticed Joaquin Phoenix was going to take on the role of the Joker. An actor that in my opinion is one of the greatest - if not the best - performers of the 20th century. Sr. Phoenix is so good at taking on roles that most people wouldn't want to take on because of how horrifying, haunting or psychologically difficult they are. As someone who absolutely loved Heath Ledger (may he rest in peace) as the Joker, I was extremely curious about Joaquin's performance when I was waiting in the theater for the movie the start. I was not disappointed, not at all. Sr. Phoenix performed beyond my expectations. To me it felt like Joaquin actually transformed 'himself' into the character which gave the personage a very realistic and terrifying touch. The story allowed this character to feel even more real, by placing him in a world that could - if not already - be real and making him face obstacles that people might actually be facing daily. As if there is a deeper message and meaning behind the story. It is very difficult to describe my thoughts on this movie, but that's what so great about it. It allows you to think for yourself. At the end of the movie, every single person in the theater probably thought of a different ending or reason for certain keypoints in the film. It wasn't just a casual "good guy bad guy" story, not at all.I rate this movie 10/10 because to this day I do not seem to be able to sum up any negative points in this movie. I enjoyed it, I will enjoy it many more times and I highly recommend you to give it a shot as well if you haven't yet - because it might just change your whole perspective on cinematography.

His portrayal of the Joker was quite rightly always going to be compared to Heath Ledgers magnificent portrayal and I, along with many many others, suspected it could not be done again. How wrong I was, Joaquin is truly unbelievable in this film, you can actually believe he has completely gone insane, just broken from the crooked system we live in. It is so strange how relatable the character is as anyone who has fell on hard times probably has gone through struggles that no one deserves and highlights so many problems in our modern day society. title: Joaquin Phoenix deserves the Oscar
review:
I am not a fan of Batman movies (though I have watched them all) and I really hated the Dark Knight movie. And the reason I hated it was the reason everyone loved it. It was Heath Ledger. His acting was the epitomy of abnoxious. It was sooo annoying to watch him. But then he died and everyone praised his acting even more.
I am not a fan of Joker either. When I saw this movie's trailer I was like Oh my here we go again. Another annoying movie.
I was not supposed to watch it. But after all the success and the reviews I decided to watch it, not in order to enjoy it but in order to see what everyone was talking about and have my own opinion.
I was shocked because instead of watching a mehh movie I watched a masterpiece.
I really do not understand why many governments banned this movie for people under 18 (it is not scary or gory) and I do not understand why people expected mass shootings or things like that.
This is JUST A MOVIE. Not scarier than other movies I have watched. It is a movie about people with mental illnesses and about people who are neglected by their country and authorities.
But what makes this movie really worth watching is Joaquin Phoenix. I like him as an actor but I never thought he was THAT good. He is excellent.

title: cool
review: It is impossible to characterize this film otherwise. This is a work of art, thought out in detail and filmed. The film can not be liked, does not cause a desire to revise it, but you admire it. Despite all the tragedy, all the pain that is contained in each frame, the film really admires. Although most of the reviews, both critics and viewers, are positive, there are fierce disputes about the film: someone does not like it decisively, someone sees in the film only the Joker, the villain opposing Batman. For me, this film is primarily about people, about the need to always treat everyone humanely. "No one owes anyone anything," I don't dispute that phrase, but even without doing anything good to a person, you can be kind to them the second your lives cross."The Joker" is a one-man story, as frightening as it is realistic. title: Hands down the best movie I have ever seen.
review: When I heard that they were doing another joker movie, I didn't care for it at all. I went to see it anyway, and I'm extremely happy I did. title: A dark twist of a movie made for Joaquin Phoenix, one of the greatest actors alive today
review: If ever there was a role made for a master actor, one who can wring out the lurking, soulful depths of depravity and insanity, with such intensity it is spellbinding, it is Joaquin Phoenix. From Commodus to Johnny Cash to the guy who falls in love with Her to the incredibly overlooked role he played in Master, the range of this best there is professional is beyond description. His every move, every sound, every painful looking move of the emaciated body he lost 55 plus pounds to play grinds with the grit and scum of the streets of crushing New York. His descent into insanity is a work of art. His laughter was so intense and so biting it will cause nightmares. Others have played tormented minds with great success. Violent, yes. So is the endless bottom of the pit shoveled over to the bottom of the heap of society, one of which he plays to perfection. It's a dark movie. Going insane is dark. And you will witness it line by line and be mesmerized by what you see Phoenix doing in every scene. There is hardly any room in this film for any of the other good actors. Don't miss it.3 out of 5 found this helpful.Was this review helpful?Sign into vote.Permalink

title: Simply masterful.
review: I'm seriously not a fan of the whole Marvel explosion of films that ,no matter how you view them , ends up being the same picture. This Warner Brother's film ,of the DC comic's top villain Joker, is nothing like any of those films. It's dark, depressing, bleak and extremely slow. Instead of letting the special fx's, fight scenes and testosterone filled action take center stage, it allows space for a mesmerizing acting performance by Joaquin Phoenix. Many are saying that he copied Deniro's performance in Taxi Driver, but I say that he honestly topped that performance by a mile. Deniro had no boundaries. Phoenix had to craft his performance within the boundaries of the comic book super villain named Joker, and he masterfully makes the transformation right in front of our eyes, within 120 minutes.The plot has been criticized for being heavy handed, but honestly the simple fact that we can have such a story still be relevant in 2019, shows that as a society we haven't been heavy handed enough. There are no happy endings in Joker. Some might say that it even glorifies or at least justifies the evils of the world. Maybe it does. But remember , the story ,like Phoenix's performance is bound by the DC story in the first place. If you have a problem with the bleakness , it might be because you are coming to the realization that at some point we will be Gotham because we are definitely following on the path of Gotham's past that this film represents.Overall, I don't know of a better Comic book film. As a matter of fact , it's the only comic book film of recent years that is Oscar worthy.

title: A beautiful dark and hard to watch MASTERPEICE üñ§
review:
I'm literally impressed and extremely happy
Joker will be the beginning of a revolution in the world of cinema and comic book movies ( i hope ).
This movie is brilliant, thrilling, sad and a beautiful dark masterpiece.
A spectacular character study with an unbelivebale and outstanding performance from Joaquin Phoenix, this is by far the best performance in last
10 years, the way he laughs, his body language, his eyes, his facial expressions are all out of this world, Joaquin conveys all types of emotions in a sensational way.
The story is well paced and takes us step by step with arther and his fall from sanity to insanity each action and each detail matters and affects the coming events and makes us as audience understand to some degree the horrible actions that arther will do in the future.
This movie accuses us the society and puts the blame on us for the way we treat ourselves and how we create within us monsters.
The Joker that we get in the end is a moving representation of the corruption in our society and especially our media wich explains why there is a group of "critcs" that are demonizing
The movie and ignoring the art in it and the big message it carries.
Todd Philips you surprised me this is big jump in your career from comedy to such a perfected drama the shots, the close ups, the cinematography, the tone of the movie everything is really masterful and of course how can i forget Hildur guonadottir and her mesmerizing score that fits perfectly each scene and each transformations arther goes through, her soundtrack plays with our emotions and our nerves and makes us feel the darkness of this movie.
This Film is nearly perfect, hard to watch, tough and makes you think about a lot of things. The only thing that may be bugging for some is the heavy inspiration from Scorsese's movies especially taxi driver and the king of comedy, i don't consider this a bad thing each filmmaker must be ispired from other works but it's a little but obvious here even so it's not a problem for me and because of all the other good things that impressed me and touched my soul and the questions that this work of art made me ask i give it a 10/10.

title: Amazing from start to finish
review: As someone who's loved Batman (and the Joker, respectively) since I was a child, I think I was going to enjoy the film regardless of how it turned out. Despite the fact that I was so hyped, I still had low expectations. So when I got up after two hours in the auditorium, I was blown away by how fresh and riveting the film was. Joaquin Phoenix played the role perfectly, and the character and story was beautifully created by Todd Phillips. Some of the dialogue wasn't very memorable, but then I realised that not every line has to be. After all, this film was meant to be what could possibly happen in a real scenario, and not everything said in real life is poetic or memorable. So that being said, I really have no faults with this movie. It was everything I wanted and more.3 out of 5 found this helpful.Was this review helpful?Sign into vote.Permalink

title: Engaging from start to finish
review: This film was engaging from the very first moment to the very last. That is not to say every moment was a blockbuster high action event, but the acting, pacing, and staging of every scene was so dynamic and carefully crafted that one feels engaged at all times, regardless of energy level. Joaquin Pheonix is truly a master of acting, and his ability to completely transform into Arthur is astounding. The piece that truly sells his role as Joker are his eyes: he truly has a madness in his eyes and they pierce through the screen. This film does not seem to fit into any one genre (horror, action/adventure, comedy) but rather is more like a character study and artistic demonstration on the formation of Joker in Gotham City. This is a modern, self-aware, psychologically relevant perspective on a traditionally outlandish, wild, and inexplicably wild villain from DC cannon. This sets a new standard for DC films, and puts the previous flops to even greater shame.3 out of 5 found this helpful.Was this review helpful?Sign into vote.Permalink

title: normally when I come to the cinema to watch DC movies, DC usually let me down recently.
review:
It is weird, normally when I come to the cinema to watch DC movies, DC usually let me down recently. But Joker 2019 is different. Bear in mind, Im no movie critic or something, Im just trying to justify my review as a fan who finally get the movie he want.
Normally, for a villain character, movie makers fail to justify his "evilness". Because they tend to isolate the character with the world around them, thus general movies create theme of "edginess" that me and others despite the most. But Joker is not a character, if somebody ask me to describe who, what, how is Joker, it is extremely difficult for me to explain who he Joker. Joker is more like a presentation of the society around him (Gotham City). There is no "right right" in this kind of scenario. Any characters in the movie are flawed in their own way. Many of them like Thomas Wayne of "the rich" are evil in many standard, but they convince themselves and the society around them that they are "all good". But Athur (Joker) fight back that kind of attitude, he tried to seek help but all the help he receive just pushed him further into madness. In the end, he is nobody, Arthur gave up his identity the society gave him to be reborn as Joker.
I have to say, watching Joker is very uneasy experience, it is very disturbing to be honest. So watch with ur own regard. But this is what art is, to push border, to go above and beyond normal standard. This film is definately special.

title: An epitome of Excellence
review: To the people, who say Joaquin Phoneix deserves an Oscar for his performance, please pardon me, but I beg to differ. This guy does not deserve an Oscar, Oscar should beg in front of him and say "Please accept me!". He is a walking university of acting. Every scene, every private moment, every emotion, its beyond human perfection! This kind of cinema is a rare commodity. I could give million stars to how everything in this movie was picture perfect (from direction to music to acting to cinematography to screenplay). Please watch it in theaters. You will not be disappointed!3 out of 5 found this helpful.Was this review helpful?Sign into vote.Permalink

title: Best movie I've seen in a long time! Absolute Masterpiece!!
review: I would like to start off by saying that Joaquin Phoenix is a goddamn genius! His acting is out of this world and it truly brings together this beautiful movie. I seriously cannot think of one thing I didn't like about the movie and honestly I don't understand how people can possibly dislike it. First off, for people saying it's slow and boring, it's not meant to be a typical action packed superhero movie. If you went into the movie thinking that's what you were getting with this movie then you need to take a film education class. And if you don't see the amount of finesse and time was put into the movie then I don't know what to tell you. All in all, thank you Joaquin and Todd for creating such a beautiful historic movie! If this movie doesn't win at least 1 or 2 oscars on top of Joaquin alone then we will riot with clown masks.3 out of 5 found this helpful.Was this review helpful?Sign into vote.Permalink

title: Not an action movie, but a psychological thriller.
review: I see a lot more great reviews for this now but when it first came I saw a lot of hate. I don't understand that at all, those people to me only wanted an action movie as they apparently didn't have the intelligence to understand a psychological thriller like this. As I stated, this wasn't trying to be an action movie, it wanted to show the Jokers transformation from harmless crazy guy down the street to full on psychotic criminal kingpin. I don't think this is really a major spoiler, but I loved how we were able to see young Bruce Wayne's story unfold in the background as well! I told my sister when we talked about a sequel that if she wanted to know what happens next, go straight to Christopher Nolan's Dark Knight, then you'll be able to watch two brilliant performances in a row as the Joker, (You were awesome, too, Bale, but this is about the Joker- lol). and basically see the whole story of his life in those two movies. But, that's not to say I'm not onboard with a Joker sequel! I think this is in the running, if not the front runner, for my best movie if the year, but I'll have to sit down and have a look at all the others I've seen! Awesome flick!

title: Truly a masterpiece!
review: This movie isn't for all viewers who subscribe to mature audience material, especially viewers with acute depression and other mental disorders. Yet those who courageously go through the motions will find a high level of appreciation for the extreme psychologically graphic material delivered masterfully by an actor whose whole career is outshone by his performance in this movie alone.This being said, the iconic supervillain is finally seen coming to terms with his downhill path to unlock his true nature that defines the true nature of the Clown Prince of Crime, and the sordid story of his relationship to his mother.Much also provided with DeNiro's up top performance that greatly magnifies the intensity of one of the most shockingly memorable movie climax moment seen in years.Joaquin Phoenix outdid himself all around and outdid the hype masterfully.

title: I'll never listen to Frank Sinatra the same way again...
review: Joker is an outstanding character study. One of 2019's biggest surprises, pushing the boundaries of what you're comfortable with looking at. Not once did it seem like I was watching a comic book movie. It's a chilling and artful approach to the iconic villain that doesn't hold back on exploring mental illness and the lower class in a brutally raw and honest way. Even with its occasional touches on the Batman mythos, which flowed well with the story and didn't seemed forced at all, the focus is entirely on Arthur Fleck's turmoil and transformation into the Joker and Joaquin Phoenix delivers a richly disturbing performance to support that. The psychological twists to some story cliches were unexpected and refreshing, too. Amazing film. Not for the faint of heart. I'll never listen to Frank Sinatra the same way again.3 out of 5 found this helpful.Was this review helpful?Sign into vote.Permalink

title: All I have are positive reviews
review: Just got back from seeing it 4 hours ago and it was as great as I thought it was gonna be, Joaquin Phoenix's performance is fantastic (everyone else is great too but Joaquin commands the entire thing), the score and soundtrack were fantastic, the opening credits fit perfectly with the theme, and even the cinematography is great (this was a grimier, dirtier, and uglier Gotham City than what we're used to). it can easily pass as a scorsese flick since his fingerprints were left after leaving the producer's chair. I'm torn between which joker I like best between ledger and Phoenix, but I know that heath ledger would be very proud of Joaquin for pulling it off, give him ALL the oscars I say, he's earned them. but anyway, I recommend this to scorsese fans and joker fans alike. I definitely wanna see it again, maybe even buy the blu-ray. on a side note, for it being a slow burn, it's actually a slow burn done right like The Godfather3 out of 5 found this helpful.Was this review helpful?Sign into vote.Permalink

title: I created an account just to review this movie
review: I went into this movie skeptical in terms of the hype around it. Now I understand it and I believe it deserves every part of it. The acting was, without exaggerating , the best I've ever seen from a male protagonist. As a literature enthusiast, the plot gave me the same feeling of watching a true literary classic unfold. Artistically, the construction of the scenes was immaculate, with the television reflecting the protagonist's psychological state and the recurring motifs of laughter and media used in the brightest of ways. The political commentary was not only well constructed but also incredibly relevant in our times. I believe it was made for people to watch and think about it and live with it's emotions for a while. It is an unequal experience for different viewers. title: Prodigious.
review:
I was pretty sure I was gonna like it but this film left me walking out the cinema speechless. The finest piece of work from Phoenix and Phillips.I have never rated or reviewed before, so this is my first one because I need to express my judgment for this movie simply because of the movie it ended up to be after anticipating since the start of production. This kind of acting and directing is exactly what I love and I consider to be my favourite being the huge film fanatic I am so I want to give all movies the right rating according to how I find them, so I would never usually give a movie a 10 because for me it has to be if not faultless but I am going to give this movie a 10 and to me here's why. I have always been a fan of Todd Phillips since his early goofy comedies to his later movies where I can tell he has set up a nice distinct directing technique and that is what I love about directors and the different styles they all have and use to put a film together, to then see what they bring to screen, but the way he has emphasised this film is truly remarkable. I didn't expect he would create and present a pure masterpiece but that is exactly what it is.
I have always loved Heath Ledger's portrayal of Joker, it was extremely stupendous, One of the best acting roles we have ever seen in film history, you couldn't disagree. But what Joaquin Phoenix had innovated was so unique and astounding, it was exactly what I look for in playing a psychotic character. I was honestly blown away with his performance. I am going to be extremely disappointed and confused if these two men don't receive an Oscar for best writing/directing and an Oscar for best actor. I feel like I shouldn't even have to mention the fact that it was fairly especial and absolutely nothing like a film you would think is DC, to me it's not a superhero/villain comic book character movie. It is the best character study flick I have ever seen. I know it won't be for everyone considering the few scenes of strong voilence and language and could be disturbing to some so I understand peoples different opinions on how they find the film but I found it to be precisely a literal showpiece with extraordinary qualities.
Please see it to find out.

title: Dark and profound.
review:
I purposefully didn't read other reviews, as I wanted my opinion of this film to be my own. Did I enjoy it, possibly not. It wasn't entertaining or entertainment. What it was √† dark, very dark and deeply disturbing reflection of our dysfunctional society. A society where the most vulnerable in society are marginalised and don't get the help or support they need.
This is a film about mental health and seeing it on Mental Health Awareness day provided a more powerful message than all the items on the news, in the press and on social media.
Joaquin Phoenix in the title role was beyond description in the way he bought this character to life. Chilling, frightening and yet at the same time conveying the vulnerability of a man lost in his own world, where there is no one to support him and no one who will listen to him and understand him.
Don't expect to come out of this film feeling good about yourself, but don't be surprised if you find yourself asking questions about the world we live in.3 out of 5 found this helpful.Was this review helpful?Sign into vote.Permalink

title: The best comic book movie ever?, maybe!
review: Well, I really don't know where to start, as Todd Phillips has clearly stated this movie has been inspired in the Batman comic books, but IT IS NOT, based directly in any comic o graphic novel ever published,Having said that, I consider this movie a masterpiece in every possible way. Undoubtedly one of the 10 best movies of this century, and also , without a doubt , one of the 100 best movies ever made in the history of cinema. Joaquin Phoenix is absolutely incredible in his representation of the mentally ill Arthur Fleck, and as the Joker is, well, absolutely out of this world. The Oscar to best actor should not even enter the competition this year, it belongs to him. A stark portrait of the cruelty of modern society, a superb reminder that mental illness is real and affects thousands of people around the world. What more can be said? Todd Phillips and Joaquin Phoenix, and the rest of the crew and cast deserve a standing ovation. BRAVO !!!!!!!!!!3 out of 5 found this helpful.Was this review helpful?Sign into vote.Permalink

title: Do not believe the mainstream paid critics!

title: Masterful Filmmaking!
review: It's rare when we get to see a movie that's this close to perfect. Normally something or another, sometimes multiple things, are lacking in a movie. It could be one of the actors, the writing, the cinematography could be subpar, and on and on. To have a movie made like that this is so nearly flawless across the board is very special.Joaquin Phoenix plays, quite likely, his best performance to date which says a lot considering how many great roles he's already done in his life. When I first heard about this movie when it was in the works I'll admit that I thought Joaquin was miscast. Boy was I wrong and in retrospect I'm not sure why I thought that.Another thing that concerned me initially was that the director, Todd Phillips, was unproven as anything other than a comedy director (to me). Another major miss on my part there. Todd Phillips did an absolutely amazing job both directing and writing this masterpiece of a movie.Going back to what I said above, most movies suffer from scenes that are either wasteful, serving no purpose or scenes that are flawed. All of these scenes serve a purpose and succeed at it very well by adding to the movie in some way or elevating the movie in some way. Further, there were some scenes that if they weren't in the movie the movie as a whole would have been less cohesive. Todd Phillips did such an amazing job walking the fine line between having redundant scenes or scenes that barely told us enough to paint the picture of how The Joker became The Joker.Truly an amazing movie. I'd rate it between a 9.5 and a perfect 10.

title: Jack Nicholson's Joker is a (very) distant third.
review:
Let me start by saying, this is a DC universe I want to further explore.The movie does an excellent job connecting most of the main Gotham characters and the possibilities for a sequel or sequels are endless.
Joaquin Phoenix deserves the Oscar for best male lead. His performance of Arthur Fleck (i.e. Joker) is truly remarkable and with minimal dialogue, he conveys pain, disgust and an eventual decent to madness that will shock you. This is the most realistic Batman related movie.
The movie is a character and society study. On one hand, a character abused, beaten, humiliated and totally ignored and on the other hand, a society literary overrun by rats.
The story of the particular Joker is truly heartbreaking. From a boy full of happiness to the Joker. By the end of the movie, you are shocked but feel that you understand why Arthur Fleck became the Joker.
Don't pay attention to the "woke" media. Joker is an excellent movie and maybe one of the best comic book movies.3 out of 5 found this helpful.Was this review helpful?Sign into vote.Permalink

title: Time to start deconstructing superheroes
review: Joaquin Phoenix is terrific and so is the film. Just like the era where westerns faded into dystopian anti-westerns, I hope we're going to start deconstructing superhero films. I agree with Martin Scorsese that superhero movies are closer to theme parks than actual cinema. He's nowhere near the first person to say it but he's right nonetheless. I hope we're entering an era in film where superheroes are deconstructed. That would be far more interesting than roller coasters.Regarding the film, I wouldn't have expected that a deep dive into the failings of our mental health system merging with grass-roots anti-fascist politics would be this compelling but here we are.I never really cared for Batman - he always seemed to be just a rich guy with expensive toys - so I guess I was open to the message but still, very very good movie (also very violent, don't take the kiddies).

title: A Masterpiece
review: This film transcends its genre in a way I wasn't sure possible, and it is all credited to the understanding of the titular character by both the actor playing him, and the director directing him. I am an avid Joker fan. I read the comics, own many of the iconic graphic novels that center around him, and I can honestly say this is the character fully realized. I was honestly baffled by the level of character depth revealed, not just in the acting, but also in the direction. This movie is literally Arthur Fleck, aka Joker's, point of view; and the director and lead actor take you down the rabbit hole descent into madness in the best possible way. It's both incredibly original, and yet incredibly grounded and respectful of who the Joker is, and what we the fans have come to expect. The movie is not for everyone. It is not an action packed thrill ride. It's not an ultra violent theme park ride of sadism. It is a very realistic, psychologically in-depth character study thriller. It's slow burn tension, the tension being the character's descent into madness. I found myself on edge waiting for him to snap, and yet hoping that he would not. I did not expect that at all, and I can only praise the film more because of that. It creates depths I had not expected, nor had I imagined. Yet there they were! In short, Joker sits firmly next to The Dark Knight as a masterpiece of comic book filmmaking. They're the only two films that transcend the genre, and they both center around The Joker. Coincidence? I think not.

title: Flawless Masterpiece
review: I made an account just to review this film. I have been hyped since the first trailer dropped (which I must have watched several dozen times, and several more in the run up to the release), and had the pleasure of seeing it last night.This was hands down one of the greatest cinematic experiences I have had the pleasure of being part of. There's nothing I can say that hasn't been said already. The hype is honestly real and deserved.Everything from Joaquin Phoenix's performance to the music score, directing, and especially the writing, was flawless. This was such a beacon of hope in a time when big blockbuster CG films are all the rage. All that matters when you strip that away are characters. If you don't have great characters, no matter how pretty your film looks, it's not worth the time of day - and this film proves that. I hope more directors and writers learn a thing or two from this. And I don't mean to copy: I mean to write better characters and stories.I'll touch on the negative media reviews quickly by just saying: once in a blue moon, a masterful piece of art like this comes around, and of course the media try to create a moral panic around it. I won't deny that aspects and themes of the film are relevant to this day and age. After all, art is a reflection of the society it was created in. There's two levels to art: face value and what the piece itself represents at its core, and then its wider connections to the real world. It's up to us how we interpret it, and that's what art is supposed to do - to get people talking. This film has certainly done that, and it's a good thing. It's one of those films that will be studied and looked back on in a hundred years, for both its cinematic marvels as well as its relevance to today.tl;dr 9999999999999/10 would watch again

title: A flawless and unique departure from comic book movies.
review: Joker; the movie I never knew I needed. A cinematic breakthrough in the comic book movie genre, that despite being overly referred to as a masterpiece, is for sure a masterpiece. Todd Phillips directs Joker, the character study centred around Arthur Fleck, played by Joaquin Phoenix. A mentally ill man shunned by society, who finds himself on a rather dark path of discovery. This is undeniably the breath of fresh air the genre has needed since James Mangold's Logan.Without doubt the films greatest success, is it's ability to have you empathise and sympathise with an antagonist. Todd Phillips took one of the greatest 'villains' in comic history, and made him a relatable character. Utilising the character study format of story telling was key to accomplishing this success, as seeing the events of Arthur Fleck's life through his own eyes feels as engaging as ever. Remaining on the 'dark and gritty' side of comic book movies, the plot consists of many appropriate comments on todays society which add to not only the character of the joker but help shed light on a subject very present in our time. Make no mistake, this is a vastly disturbing film at times, the synergy between Hildur Gu√∞nad√≥ttin's gripping score and the imagery on screen is like a schizophrenic nightmare in the best way possible. I don't think I've ever endured such range of emotions throughout a film before. Joaquin Phoenix masterfully embodies the role of both Arthur Fleck and Joker, which is putting it lightly.Visuals and production design are a phenomenal display. Gotham City not only feels like an authentic city, but becomes a character in itself. The film is enriched with colour grading and light/shadows that accommodate what tone is being conveyed. This is a film that uses visual storytelling where it can and to it's best advantage, a unique aspect of Joker. The movie in general certainly feels inspired by some of Martin Scorsese's flicks, which only makes sense due to former arrangements for him to produce, if you're a fan of Scorsese you're sure to get a kick out of this film. As I mentioned beforehand this film is a breath of fresh air for the genre. This isn't your typical superhero punch em' up loaded with insane visual effects, action and world-devastating events. This is a charmingly stylised, grounded depiction of a comic book character who could theoretically exist. Again, Pheonix puts everything into this character and embodies his role. Todd Phillips' passion project met with Joaquin Phoenix's immaculate performance creates something really special that seems to have earned itself the title of an instant classic.Whether you're hunting a flawless movie or you're just tired of the loud theme parks comic book movies have become today and are looking for something truly unique, this one exceeds all expectations.

title: Masterpiece of how the joker was born
review: I have to say that what we have here is a one off Masterpiece film directed by Todd Philips. First congrats to him and his team for putting out there one of the best realistic comic films of all time. This is where DC beat marvel because the DC villain Joker and Harvey Dent can actual happen in real life.So first to all comic fans, calm down and remember that this is a very different take on the Joker. this film does not follow any of the comic materials. This film has been made in a realistic way where it shows how society can push someone to their limits and we humans can effect people lives without even notice them.This films is a story about how someone can be pushed because of how society can treat and push someone and when someone has nothing to lose you will start to do things that you have never done. This guy was pushed so much that he started not to care and wanted to just feel good about himself. He started to find himself and his confidence is growing by the end of the film.You can't compare this joker version to any of there other joker version especially Heath's Joker because in the Dark Knight his version of the Joker has already established himself as the clown prince of crime where as Joaquin version of the Joker does not really know who he is, as the film goes on, he is trying to find himself and by the end of the film it looks like he has found himself that he looks set to explore who he is and I hope that if we can get two more films then each of the films will explore how he becomes the clown prince of crime and how he comes the most feared villain of Gotham city and Batman's most hated enemy.So remember when you hardcore comic fans watch this film, you need to remember that this is kinda of like an origins story of how someone in this case, this person becomes the joker who is becoming the someone who later will be known as the Joker or not. we have to many fan theories like this is this first joker and then we have three jokers but whatever, forget about all of the theories and go and enjoy this masterpiece. This film has a amazing soundtrack which strengthen all of the scenes which makes this film even more special. Also its not any other comic film like marvel who use too much CGI and most of their villains are not realistic which makes it sometimes not believe. I say that this film beats Marvel endgame and this has to be my favourite comic film of this year. I hope we get to see more two more films of this version of the Joker.This film does focus on people who suffer mental illness and it shows how we need to help more people in the world who suffer with mental illness and also treat everyone with full respect and help each other.So please to all fans, go and watch this film in the cinema as this is one of those films that you must watch in the cinema not at your home. This film was so emotional for me and it got me up my chair a few times. I will rate this film 5/5 stars and 10/10 rating.

title: Somehow able to exceed expectations
review: Amidst all the hype and controversy, Joaquin Phoenix shines as bright as this film is dark. The score perfectly sets the mood and acts as an eerie backdrop to the film throughout. The plot is revealed from the story and doesn't rely on narration to carry the film. You can tell Joaquin Phoenix did his homework, his portrayal of a mentally ill man struggling to survive in a time of economic hardship is masterful. He is supported by a well selected cast, including the best depiction of Bruce Wayne seen on screen. They didn't reduce Dante Pereira-Olson's Bruce into a whining bratty child as many incarnations usually do. The movie mixes the plight of our down on his luck protagonist and provides an in depth look into the current sociologic climate, without weighing down the film. An excellent blend of comic accuracy and realism is used to create something comic fans and movie fans without knowledge of the character can both enjoy.3 out of 5 found this helpful.Was this review helpful?Sign into vote.Permalink

title: The greatest piece of cinematography I have ever seen
review: This film will go down in history. Simply amazing. The whole team behind this film should be commended, as well as proud of what they have produced. Throughout the years there are many films which simply come from Hollywood and satisfy viewers but are predictable with limited long lasting impact. This is not one of those films, you will walk out of Joker with your head in the stars, unable to Express what you have just seen. Joaquin delivers the best character portrayal I have ever seen, displaying the transition from Arthur Fleck to the Joker right the way through the film. I found myself smiling at his ability to deliver a perfect personality and mannerisms which we saw from Ledger, and although Heath gave us an amazing foundation when creating his Joker, I honestly believe Joaquin has made Heath proud. I don't believe I will see a film of this capacity for a very long time, and it is almost certain the film will win best actor and best director come the Oscar's in 2020.3 out of 5 found this helpful.Was this review helpful?Sign into vote.Permalink

title: Deeply moving. Phoenix's performance is otherworldly

title: Surreal experience....
review:
I don't write reviews too often for films I see however as much as I didn't expect much coming into this movie I left with a profound sense of awareness of society around us and just what may set off certain people in such a violent manner after years of taking abuse from others and often for no other reason than careless spite and taking pleasure in someone else's misery.
The movie is truly a social statement more than anything else that many may find odious or hard to swallow but one doesn't have to look far to see how the film speaks to a lot of truths we'd rather ignore and make excuses for.
As for Joaquin Phoenix I never had much of an opinion of his acting abilities but this movie has certainly heightened his standing in my view and rivals if not surpasses Heath Ledger's portrayal in 2008.3 out of 5 found this helpful.Was this review helpful?Sign into vote.Permalink

title: A Masterpiece.
review: Many reviews here describe the movie as being: amazing, brilliant, a masterpiece and a work of art. None of those descriptions are wrong. The Joker is an extremely dark, powerful look into the mind of a man quickly descending into his own madness and inability to cope with the harsh, cruel world that surrounds him. In a cinematic world that's currently dominated by comic book movies laced with humour and CGI FX, it's ironic that a movie about The Joker provides none of that, but instead is the most serious and real of them all.3 out of 5 found this helpful.Was this review helpful?Sign into vote.Permalink

title: Absolutely BLOWN. AWAY.
review: I never write reviews but this film has been ingrained in my head ever since I watched it that I was compelled to do so. It blew past my expectations, to say the least and my expectations were already sky high. Everything was so perfect! I'll try to keep it short as I break down what stood out for me.First, the film's score. It was so well made I cannot stress this enough. It fit every single scene and made them that much more powerful. It establishes a connection between you and the character. I felt what he was going through to the point where i was rooting for him.The cinematography was beautiful! Whether it was a close shot focusing on the joker or simply a wide shot showcasing the environment around him, it was astonishing.The acting was phenomenal and that is an understatement in my opinion. Joaquin immensely knocked it out of the park. He embodied the character so well. I truly believe this is one of the best if not the BEST adaptation of the joker.I will say 1 thing for those who are hesitant towards comic book movies, it did not feel like such. Even if you're not a fan of comic books, you can still enjoy it as much as anyone else. It has such a deep meaning which will leave you thinking for days. This film will truly, without a doubt, leave a huge mark in cinematic history.

title: The Joker of our time
review: What an experience. At first I did not want to believe the hype. I avoided the trailers and wanted to experience this movie with a fresh mind. And today, where mental illness is relevant in our society, this is the perfect adaptation of the Joker in our time.You cannot compare Heath Ledger's joker with Joaquin Phoenix's. Both had incredible performances, but Phoenix's joker is different. This is not the criminal mastermind we are used to. This Joker is broken and shattered.Overall, this is the best movie of the year. I wouldn't be surprised of this movie got nominated, as well as Phoenix's performance

title: Thank you Todd Phillips and Joaquin Phoenix
review:
This is a masterpiece.
A bold statement but a true statement,
Ok this movie is getting a lot of hate And a lot of praise at the same time as it is like marmite you will either love it or not understand and fear and hate it, stating that it's promoting ill deads... it's not you need to understand it and remember it's most importantly art in the form of a film/movie.Always keep in mind it's a fictional story with fictional characters, which is difficult to do as the direction and acting are so good.
Now imagine your very darkest thought's and feeling the one's you never tell anyone,the one's that make you feel physically ill and the one's you would never act on because of your ethics your integrity and your morals,now take them time's them by 10 . That's the feeling you get from this extremely dark and thought provoking story of a man who has past the limit of sanity due to ill health and the toll of a negative outside world.
It's upsetting and moving to see such atrocities, the cruelty of man against his fellow man..
But this is true to Life,if you treat someone so badly you will break them,if life is so bad to you it will effect you, the portrayal of this side of man's inhumanity to Man is superbly portrayed by Joaquin Phoenix he pulls you into the suffering in a way that you don't want to be pulled in.The violence that insues is an equal and opposite reaction to the original actions in Arthur fleck mind, a man that suffers from mental health issues and is then bullied, beaten and mentally abused by every one around him.
During the film you feel sorry for him you feel sickened by him and you feel hate for him, the sign of a truly good performance.
I don't want to Go into any further details as I'm not the type of person to spoil it for others.
The lighting the camera work and music are a perfect backdrop for this truly disturbing glips into a comic book villians backstory...a true testiment to a great director.
My leaving comments would be looking back at the real world and some of it's band wagon hopping on statements...
This is a movie,a piece of art, and an excellent movie it is.
If you as a person can't handle how dark and disturbing it is then that's okay just walk out, it's perfectly fine to do so
But please don't trash it cause it wasn't for you.
Its not promoting gun crime
It's not demoting mental health issues
It's not promoting violence.
It's a film

title: THE Joker and more !!!
review:
Joaquin Phoenix is a shoe-in for Best Actor at next year's Oscars unless Daniel Day Lewis comes out of retirement and does something truly extraordinary. This film will bridge the gap between comic book geeks and serious cineastes because of his performance and the direction of Todd Philips. Never has Gotham looked so exhausted as it does here. No surprise that it is Joker's breeding ground. Helpless and hopeless, no wonder that he turns against the "haves".
The Joker has proved an iconic role. Just as we talk about Olivier's Henry V or Karloff's Monster or Chaney's Lenny, in the future we will be looking at Phoenix and saying "yes,it's his defining role". His speech, his body shape, his eyes - all come together to chill you to the bone. Yet there is poignancy there and inevitability and anarchy. The best film of 2019 with nothing to beat it unless Abrams pulls something out of the hat with "The Rise of Skywalker".3 out of 5 found this helpful.Was this review helpful?Sign into vote.Permalink

title: Not a movie for everyone but a masterpiece nonetheless.
review: Going into this film, I was unsure on what to think. I didn't wanna go in believing all the hype this movie had gotten but, I knew Joaquin Phoenix was one the best actors alive so I went into the movie with high expectations.Now, this movie might not be for everyone. It shifts in tone and pace a lot, there are political messages not everyone may get or enjoy. You mustn't go into this movie thinking it's your run-of-the-mill hero/villain flick', because it is anything but. This movie takes its viewers on a ride through many emotions present in the film. The script is beautifully written and Joaquin Phoenix is absolutely amazing in this rendition of the Joker character. He brings a different side of the Joker out for this film. Something I dont believe any of the former actors to have portrayed the Joker brought which is a sense of vulnerability. A sense of pain and sadness.I recommend you see the movie for yourself. It may not be a movie everyone will enjoy, but I believe it was perfectly executed and a downright masterpiece.

title: A stunning artistic achievement - DC at its peak
review:
JOKER (2019) directed by Todd Phillips and starring Joaquin Pheonix in the role of a lifetime as the titular character, is a film that explores the complexity, stigma and volatility of severe mental illness. Set in the fictional DC metropolis, Gotham City, Joker paints a nasty portrait of a damaged city, struggling with rising crime, disillusionment and 'super rats'.Arthur Fleck is barely existing as a clown for hire, living with his elderly mother in their tiny apartment; their only relief from the tragedy of their lives is watching America's favourite late-night host, Murray Franklin (Robert DeNiro) on their old television. Arthur has delusions of grandeur, imagining himself as a successful stand-up comedian, which is ironic based on his 'condition' that elicits unprovoked and uncontrollable laughter in stressful situations. A journal contains all his dark thoughts and is littered with disturbing images and expressions of suicidal ideation.The film depicts Arthur's descent into psychopathy, through revelations and events that call into the question the reality he was brought up with. The film may be deeply disturbing for some, particularly the scenes of graphic violence, that play out with the same level of overt intensity and clarity as the rest of the film - nothing is held back. In fact, the audience is left in a confusing state between horror and humour, since many of these disturbing scenes include brilliant moments of levity.That's right, it's not all psychological horror, there are moments of humour that is the result of Pheonix's mannerisms and his diabolical laugh. It's a physical performance, while director Todd Phillips maintains a consistently gloomy colour palette that is broken only by the clown paint and the clown masks that show up at various points in the film.Speaking of Pheonix, he is incredible, fully inhabiting this character and creating a genuine debate as to which Joker performance was better: him or Heath Ledger. Although such a discussion is unnecessary since they are both transcendent in their own way.JOKER is a truly incredible artistic statement that will be remembered, revered and talked about as much as the last great DC film, The Dark Knight (2008). While I am hesitant to pump out a review immediately after seeing it once, there is no doubt I will watch it again and again and wait impatiently for the next one.Highly, highly recommended
5/5

title: Best origin story in the DCEU
review: I don't understand what movie the "real" critics watched. Reviews like the ones I've read online for blogs, newspapers and other news sites continue to make me lose faith in the supposed movie critics. After seeing their reviews and then going to see this movie, I am pretty much convinced that majority of them are just a bunch of hacks and their reviews are written prior to them actually seeing a movie. I can only hope that this Joker movie isn't just the origin for the Joker, but the origin story for the next Batman. Well done Joaquin Phoenix.What happens if you had just the absolute worst day of your life? Or worst week? That's what happens to the Joker in the comics. And this portrayal of this unfortunate man who, coupled with a city facing civil unrest and growing resentment of upper classes and disdain for lower ones ends with something that could actually happen. Is it right? Is the character one to be empathized? No. He makes bad decisions. He does terrible things. But that is the JOKER. Go for the story, go for the drama. Not for action. And not if you're one of these holier than though critics that write negative reviews just to bolster their own credibility but lack an attention span to actually watch an entire movie.

title: A masterpiece.
review: This movie is a masterpiece. I just saw it in the theater today and I will go see it again. This is an amazing origin story for Joker and his minions. It is also a commentary about how far left ideology (Antifa), the media terrorizing people with exaggeration and lies, cities run by corrupt people until they are filled with trash, rats, sickness, and homeless, and turning our back on the mentally ill can lead some people to total desperation and violence. It doesn't endorse violence, but I do think it explains how some people end up there. It should be a warning. Don't let negative news take your hope and make you apathetic. Choose kindness. Don't wait for corrupt leaders to fix cities they have let go to ruin - make the city better yourself (like Scott Presler)! After doing what you can for your community, make sure to expose the people who are corrupt and taking in millions, or billions of dollars and somehow never fixing the problems in the cities that they run. Last but not least, we do need to have a better support system for the severely mentally ill, and not the waste of money NY city is doing right now. We need to help the millions of severely mentally ill people currently on the streets, not just have "feel good" programs that may prevent more.God Bless America.

title: Joaquin Phoenix for the win!
review: I used to think my life was a tragedy, but now I realize..... it's a comedyWOW. Now that's what I call an agent of chaos. Best actor goes to Joaquin Phoenix for his incredible intense mind blowing performance as Arthur Fleck, AKA Joker. This is the origin story to beat all origin stories. I was thoroughly entranced for 2 hours watching his painful transition from a beaten down sad sack to the famous insane maniacal narcissist we all know & love. I will have to see this on the big screen again soon, it was a brilliantly laid out psychological character study that gave me a lot to think about when it comes to the DC world of the caped crusader's nemesis I've always known. This story has a major shift to how I've perceived the crazed, hapless, clownfaced criminal, since I first saw him portrayed by Jack Nicholson in Tim Burton's 1989 Batman, & of course, fairly different than the outstanding portrayal by Heath in TDK. Arthur just keeps having one bad day after another, so I felt sorry for him in this story as I never had before.The score by Icelandic composer Hildur Gu√∞nad√≥ttir that was heavily powered by her dramatic cello was a perfect match to show how this story unfolds, & the classic Sinatra songs, "Send in the Clowns" & "That's Life" along with "Jimmy Durante's "Smile" were a natural choice for the soundtrack as well as several old rock songs like Cream's "White Room", The Guess Who's "Laughing", The Doors "People Are Strange", Pink Floyd's "Brain Damage", & The Bee Gees "I Started A Joke" (just to name a few) went so well with the character development.If you're expecting a comic book super villain story similar to the previous versions of Joker on the big screen, you might be disappointed. However, go see this with an open mind & watch the goddamn genius that is Joaquin play Joker as he's never been played before & maybe you'll love it like I did.

title: Haunting and wonderful.
review: This is not an easy watch, but it sure as Hell is a rewarding one.Phoenix hits it out of the park as Arthur Fletch and his descent into madness is a display like no other. The supporting cast are superb, the soundtrack is phenomenal, I really can't find a bad word to say about this film. It's a masterpiece.It's a slow burn, but that works really well for the tale the movie tells. When it does ramp up, it really ramps up, with the final act being a terrifying thrill ride.The feeling I got watching this film was reminiscent of watching Breaking Bad through for the first time. It was uncomfortable, but extraordinary, and I couldn't look away from start to finish.10/10, outstanding.

title: Absolutely BREATHTAKING movie and role play by Joaquin Phoenix
review:
First of all, let me say that I cannot emphasize enough how mind blowing this movie is. I don't know how I am supposed to enjoy a movie after this, it just won't be as good.
But let's get into it. It has been a long time since I hadn't watched a DC movie in which the scenario and the role play took over the actions and the commercial frills. This movie is realistic. It reflects the reality of a society that we might live in someday in the near future. I was also iBut the real asset of this masterpiece is Joaquin Phoenix. I don't want to fall into unfair comparisons with Heath Ledger, for the latter has had the chance to have a whole movie centered on his character. However, I just cannot imagine a more genuine, breathtaking performance as Joaquin's. I was in total admiration on each of his scenes and Joker laughs. He nailed them all. Also, the evolution of his character all along makes each segment of the movie more intense and more mind blowing than the previous.
If you're not a comic fan, this movie can easily lead you to it. It gives you chills. It's an absolute masterpiece that's not ready to be topped.3 out of 5 found this helpful.Was this review helpful?Sign into vote.Permalink

title: DC's Dark Game Changer
review:
This film was everything I wanted it to be and more. DC should stop trying to do what Marvel has and capitalise on this realistic R-rated style and tone for their films. Not many people could pull off a convincing Joker for an entire film, and neither did Phoenix. This film is about Arthur's transformation, he doesn't fully become Joker until the very end of the film.
This is the story of a man's descent into madness done in the most realistic way possible, taking little inspiration from source material and focusing on what makes the character at his core so polarising.
Aside from the incredible acting, the cinematography, score and pacing of the film married perfectly with Phoenix's take. No screen time was wasted, everything that happened had a purpose or a meaning.
The inclusion of the Waynes in the story was a surprise but a welcome one.
Laying the groundwork for the upcoming Matt Reeves Batman film potentially.
I truly do hope we get to see Phoenix do Joker properly in a future film, but for now I hope this is the catalyst to start the DC Dark series with more films in this realistic R-rated style and tone made for adults and not kids.

title: Best comic book film of all time.
review: Not only is the Joker the best comic book adaptation on film I have ever seen, it is by far the best film of 2019 I've seen. The moments that gave me chills were the scene when Arthur is holding little Bruce's face and then when he is in the stairwell with his mother's medical chart and verifies everything Tom Wayne told me was true about his mother. Learning everything he thought he knew was a lie and the anger that grew within him that bought him to such disillusionment with his world it made him kill the one person he most loved in his world and turn him into the psychopathic killer. Her death killed Arthur Fleck and reincarnated him into the Joker. The twist with Sophie Dumond (Zazie Beetz ) was brilliant and totally unexpected.Wow. This film was like a Greek Tragedy play. This is the film I wish all other comic book movies were modeled after. Nothing is over the top, everything is plausible in this realistic world. No super powers or grandiose schemes. Arthur Fleck is just a regular man like the Waynes, but without the fortunes of the Waynes. Just a man who beleaguered with abuse, lies, manipulation and misfortune that snaps into the killer he becomes.I did not want the movie to end because I loved it so much. My bladder was at the point of bursting but I did not want to leave my seat and miss a thing. This is a titanium scribed A++. It is rare I think of any movie as a perfect 10 out of 10, but this movie hit that score. I was left thinking about this film hours after I left the theater. DC Black finally blew away everything Marvel had out of the water with this film. All thanks to a super talented film director and one of the best actors of our era Joaquin Phoenix. If the Oscars don't see it fit to grant him an award, then the Oscars have no redeeming value.

title: Absolute masterpiece.

You will be disappointed. It is an utterly different genre and experience.Watch it from the point of view that every single one of us may be in Joker's place. We just need one bad (good) day. title: ART
review: An extraordinary movie, the message is strong and we must all be kind to all people and respect them! An accumulation of extreme situations, which I can say may even be realistic and quite possible at that period of time, because there was not as much information as there is today, although there is a lot of bullying these days and can sometimes be an unfortunate cause of some dramatic situations that happen, but as a fictional movie (that's what it is), I think overall the movie is almost perfect! I don't know if will be considered for Best Picture due to the hypocrisy that exists in the United States, but Phoenix deserves to win any awards that appear, it is the best role of his career! From the beginning to the end of the movie it's a brutal character transformation and he drove it to the limit to embody a Fiction character who was always been an psychopath and let's say he already deserves it for a long time! And a casting that fits the story very well, although they rarely appear, are crucial to the development of this character. I'm sorry it's just this movie made by Todd Phillips and Phoenix ... But I have a little hope that Phoenix will be able to reconsider returning to the role in Matt Reeves's batman movie, as a older joker, if not I think Dc (Dc Black) could advance with more mature movies like this one! 9.5

title: Pure cinematic bliss
review: Now THIS is a comic book movie worthy of oscar attention. There's a lot going on here. We see the inside of a troubled man as he goes through the transformation of turning into DC's finest villain. Todd Philips and Joaquin Phoenix have created an emotional, brutal and almost painful film to watch (in a good way). The film follows Arthur Fleck's character throughout the entire run-time and the audience is pulled into this sad man's life as everything just seems to be tumbling around him. The way people treat him and the way his behavior unintentionally makes others uncomfortable is tough to watch but it is a brutal reminder of the hardships faced by people like him. Watching him turn into this downward spiral into the villainous Joker is entertaining, rewarding and disturbing. The film is about the evolution of this broken down man trying to find a place in society and then taking another path instead. This is a tragic tale done excellently. The cinematography and score is stunning, the directing is extremely good as well. The use of songs in the film are very well done. Every character really sells their role in the film, from the bullies, to the ones that try to help, to the extras in the talk show. Everyone brings their A-game into this film and nothing feels out of place. Joker is destined to be a cult classic and it's a hopeful change in direction for comic based films. This is a movie that will be remembered for a long time.
